page.title: 13PRESERVING ECOLOGY
page.content: We are helping to clean up Kirkley Ham & make it into a home for nature. People have been using The Ham as a rubbish dump. It was very marshy & muddy so I had to wear my old clothes & wellingtons. I had a bag to put the rubbish in. We found crisp packets, buckets, a bed spring & part of a car engine. There were 3 railway signs, a train lamp & 2 doors because trains used to run over The Ham. We stacked the big bits into a pile & someone took a photo of us for the paper. Then we had a drink of orange. Some of the flowers that grow on The Ham are Lupin, Clover, Willowherb & Flag. The stream is very polluted but we found a newt, some snails and tadpoles. Emma saw a rat & we saw some blue-tits. In the reeds Jenny found a mallard's nest with eggs in it.
